turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Telecommunication transaction processing systems.
turn.1: What is the difference between TPS and Telecommunication transaction processing systems?
turn.2: Some high-end TPS combines information from various elements to create master CDRs before being loaded into the 'datastore', whilst a lower-end or entry-level TPS directly loads data upon completion of CDR duplicate checking.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: The 'datastore' used by the TPS consists of a Relational database management system.
turn.5: Do they have any other uses?
turn.6: Some high-end enterprise RDMS includes the likes of ORACLE, Microsoft SQL Server and MySQL.
turn.7: What are the differences between them?
turn.8: The choice of RDMS to use, is usually driven by company policy, price and recommendations from the TPS supplier.
turn.9: What is the most common use?
turn.10: The RDMS should at least be able to support the volumes of CDRs generated by the particular network.
turn.12: Once all intermediate processing on the CDR batches have completed, the TPS can now load the data into the particular 'datastore'.
